results.title: The Battle for Bowen Hills
results.creator_credit: Peter Gray, Crowsfoot Films and Garry Lane
results.brief_description: The story of Brisbane working class residents’ protracted struggle to defend their homes against the inner city freeway proposals of the Queensland Government. This film was made for community groups under a similar threat and for those interested in multinational development and the political economy of transport. Narrated by Geraldine Willisee. (Also includes ex-Queensland Senator Russ Hinze).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Gray, Crowsfoot Films and Garry Lane

results.title: Marathon I
results.creator_credit: John Blackett-Smith Productions and Tim Kupsch
results.brief_description: Looks at the individual training strategies and motivation of top world marathon runner Robert de Castella of Australia and Alberto Salazar of the USA. Follows each of them as they fight it out in the 1982 Rotterdam marathon, highlighting the incredible winning performance by de Castella, who after having run twenty-five miles at a rate of five minutes per mile, covered the last mile in a staggering four minutes and thirty-two seconds.

results.title: The Singer and the Dancer
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong and Australian Film Council
results.brief_description: Set in the country, an older woman relives the bitter memories of her past, through her friendship with a younger girl who is experiencing a very insecure relationship with her boyfriend. Winner of several awards including Australian Film Awards and Sydney Film Festival. Cast includes Ruth Cracknell, Elizabeth Crosby, Russell Keifel, Jude Kuring, Gerry Duggan, Julie Dawson, Jane Buckland, Kate Sheil, Rob Steele, Kerry Walker. Photographer: Russell Boyd. Based on a short story by Alan Marshall.

results.title: This woman is not a car
results.creator_credit: Margaret Dodd, Vyner Gillespie, Jenny Jacobs and Arid Zone Productions
results.brief_description: A mother, isolated in an outer Adelaide suburb, drives a station wagon full of children to a distant beach. Imagination and reality fuse. Her sense of herself is assaulted by car fetishists in a rural service station. Memory, fear and fantasy are interwoven as this experimental film takes woman’s assigned role in the ‘Australian Dream’ to its absurd conclusion. Music: Brian Eno, The Fabulous Nudes, The Pelaco Bros. Actors include Pauline Sedgwick, Daniel Sedgwick, Lisa Sedgwick, Gareth Sedgwick and Katrina Sedgwick.

results.title: Big painter
results.brief_description: A chronological study of the production of a mural by John Firth-Smith begun in 1978 and completed in 1981. The huge painting measures 6m x 48m and hangs in the headquarters of the ANZ Bank, Melbourne.

results.title: Gordon splits
results.creator_credit: Michael Cordell, Wilderness Society (Australia) and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative
results.brief_description: Peter Dombrovskis, Australia’s foremost Wilderness photographer, photographs two spectacular gorges in South West Tasmania. He talks about his own experience of wilderness and the threat of flooding.

results.title: The Ghost in the shed
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: A whimsical story of a polite but persistent ghost of a secretly buried murder victim. His attempts to draw attention to his remains mystify the family in the house. Based on the book by Marilynne K. Roach.

results.title: Do not pass go
results.creator_credit: Kent Chadwick, Victorian Film Corporation and Phil de Montingnie
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of the story of two young people and their confrontation with the law. Set in the streets, in the children’s courts and in the prisons, it shows that Australian welfare systems do not necessarily assist such teenagers. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: A Puppet pudding
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation, David Perry, Michael Creighton and Marionette Theatre of Australia
results.brief_description: An introduction to the world of Norman Lindsay’s classic Australian children’s story “The Magic Pudding”, using puppets from the Marionette Theatre of Australia’s stage production. Explores the background to the writing of the story and looks behind the scenes of Australia’s national puppet theatre. Concludes with characters on stage at the Sydney Opera House. Presenter: Richard Bradshaw.
